intro: Buchnera verdickii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. Buchnera verdickii is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance.
